intro: Conyza monocephala, commonly known as the common mouseear, is an annual flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant has small, hairy leaves and produces white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields. Conyza monocephala is also known for its ability to spread through wind-dispersed seeds, making it a common weed in many regions.
